x-sap-shortText: The Emarsys SMS API helps you run SMS marketing campaigns.

info.title: SAP Emarsys SMS API
info.description: The Emarsys SMS API enables you to handle your SMS marketing campaigns through an API.

externalDocs.description: The official up-todate documentation of the Emarsys SMS API.

get.description:
Returns a list of ongoing SMS campaigns.

**Example**

`https://api.emarsys.net/api/sms/campaigns?limit=1000&offset=0`

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Limits the number of SMS campaigns returned in the list.

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: Used to skip a number of SMS campaigns before results are fetched (remember that campaigns are listed in a *latest first* fashion).

type.description: Indicates whether the campaign is part of an AC program.

status.description:
The SMS campaign status.

- If **type** is set to *ac*,  **status** may only take the values *draft* and *triggered*.

- If **type** is set to *batch*, the possible **status** values are *draft*, *scheduled*, *triggered*, *sending*, *report_receiving*, and *done*.

title.description: The title of the SMS campaign.

message.description: The body text of the message.

deduplicate_recipients.description: Indicates whether the logic should consider contact duplication.

enabled.description: Indicates whether unsubscribing is enabled, that is, the Opt-out button is part of the messages sent.

title.description: The text used to trigger the Unsubscribe action.

text.description: The text asking for unsubscription confirmation.

button_text.description: The text of the button used for confirming the unsubscribe request.

source_type.description:
Indicates the recipient source:
- segment
- contact list
- AC program

source_id.description: Indicates the ID of the recipient source.

created_at.description: Indicates when the SMS campaign was created.

400.description: The error codes vary between 400 and 500.

unsubscribe.title: Unsubscribe
unsubscribe.text: Are you sure you want to opt out of our SMS campaigns?
unsubscribe.after_text: You've been removed from our SMS campaign list.

get.description: Returns the SMS campaign with the specified campaign ID.

type.description: Indicates whether the campaign is part of an AC program.

status.description:
The SMS campaign status.

- If **type** is set to *ac*,  **status** may only take the values *draft* and *triggered*.

- If **type** is set to *batch*, the possible **status** values are *draft*, *scheduled*, *triggered*, *sending*, *report_receiving*, and *done*.

title.description: The title of the SMS campaign.

message.description: The body text of the message.

deduplicate_recipients.description: Indicates whether the logic should consider contact duplication.

enabled.description: Indicates whether unsubscribing is enabled, that is, the Opt-out button is part of the messages sent.

title.description: The text used to trigger the Unsubscribe action.

text.description: The text asking for unsubscription confirmation.

button_text.description: The text on the button used for confirming the unsubscribe request.

created_at.description: Indicates when the SMS campaign was created.

scheduled_to.description: Indicates the scheduled launche date of the campaign.

400.description: The error codes vary between 400 and 500.

put.description:
"Lets you update an existing SMS campaign.

---
**Mandatory
parameters**

At least one of the following:

- **type**: the type can
only be changed from *ac* to *batch* if no active AC program uses the campaign
-
**title**
- **sender**
-	**message**
-	**deduplicate_recipients**
-	**source_type**
(**source_type** and **source_id** must be present in the suite in case of
*batch* campaigns, and must be *null* or undefined for campaigns with **type**
*ac*)
-	**source_id**
-	**unsubscribe.enabled**
-	**unsubscribe.title**
-	**unsubscribe.text**
-	**unsubscribe.button_text**
-	**unsubscribe.after_text**

---
**Forbidden
parameters**

In order to change the following parameters, a **Launch a
Campaign** request must be made:
-	**status**
- **scheduled_to**

---
**IMPORTANT**
Make
sure the following conditions apply:
- The recipient source exists in the
Suite if **source_type**|**source_id** is updated.
-	a campaign can only
be updated while it is in either *draft** or *scheduled* state. If the campaign
is in *scheduled* state, the **scheduled_to** date must be at least 1 minute
in the future.
- TWIG template syntax is used."

parameters.description: The name of the campaign to be updated.

type.description: Indicates whether the campaign is part of an AC program.

title.description: The title of the SMS campaign.

message.description: The body text of the message.

Indicates the recipient source:

title.description: The text used to trigger the Unsubscribe action.

button_text.description: The text of the button used for confirming the unsubscribe request.

patch.description:
"Lets you launch/schedule a *batch* campaign, or cancel its scheduled launch by updating the value of the **status** attribute the following way:

**1.**
To launch the campaign at a specific date (schedule a campaign):

-
{
  "**status**": "*scheduled*",
  
  "**scheduled_to**": "2018-02-28T13:15:00.000Z"
}

**2.**
To launch the campaign immediately:

 - {
  "**status**": "*triggered*"
}

**3.**
To cancel a scheduled launch:

- {
  "**status**": "*draft*"
}
___
**Mandatory
parameters:**
- **customerId**
- **campaignId**
- **status** (*draft*
or *triggered*)
___
Campaigns with **type** *AC* must be triggered/scheduled/canceled
through an AC program.

**Note**: Only campaigns in *scheduled* state
can be canceled."

parameters.name: body
parameters.description: The name of the campaign to be launched.

status.description:
The status of the SMS campaign:
- **scheduled**: scheduled to a future date.
 - **triggered**: for launching the campaign right away.
- **draft**: used for cancelling a scheduled launch.

scheduled_to.description: Should be a future date in UTC format.

status.description: The status of the SMS campaign.

title.description: The title of the SMS campaign.

message.description: The body text of the message.

deduplicate_recipients.description: Indicates whether the logic should consider contact duplication.

enabled.description: Indicates whether the SMS will contain an unsubscribe link.

title.description: The text used to trigger the Unsubscribe action.

text.description: The text asking for unsubscription confirmation.

button_text.description: The text of the button used for confirming the unsubscribe request.

created_at.description: Indicates when the SMS campaign was created.

scheduled_to.description: Indicates the scheduled launche date of the campaign.

source_type.description:
Indicates the recipient source:
- segment
- contact list
- AC program

source_id.description: The ID of the  recipient source.

400.description: The error codes vary between 400 and 500.

get.description:
Fetches inbound SMS messages in **latest first** order.

**Example:**

``api.emarsys.net/api/sms/inbound-messages?limit=500&offset=100?startDate=2018-02-28T13%3A15%3A00.000Z&endDate=2018-03-05T00%3A00%3A00.000Z``

parameters.name: {limit}
parameters.description: The maximum number of inbound SMS  fetched by request.

parameters.name: {offset}
parameters.description: The logic will start fetching after skipping the number of inbound sms messages specified here.

parameters.name: {startDate}
parameters.description:
All fetched inbound SMS messages will be newer than the date specified here.
It must be URL-encoded.

parameters.name: {endDate}
parameters.description:
All fetched inbound SMS messages will be older than the date specified here.
It must be URL-encoded.

contact_id.description: The internal contact identifier for your customer. For details, see **Concepts** > **Contacts**.

shortcode.description: A short string of numbers identified with your brand.

is_unsubscribe.description:
Indicates whether the sender opted out from SMS campaigns.
If the message contains the word **STOP**, the value will be *true*.

inbound_number.description: The number where the SMS was received from.

message_body.description: The body text of the message received.

enabled.description: Indicates whether unsubscribing is enabled, that is, the Opt-out button is part of the messages sent.

title.description: The text used to trigger the Unsubscribe action.

text.description: The text asking for unsubscription confirmation.

button_text.description: The text of the button used for confirming the unsubscribe request.
